definition: strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort

sentences.english: Then they cut him in two with a sharp sword, and left both halves of his body in the middle of the road.
sentences.chinese: 強盜們用一把鋒利的劍把牧師砍成兩截留在了路中央。

sentences.english: The robber abduct the heiress and hold her to ransom.
sentences.chinese: 強盜劫持了女繼承人並向她索取贖金。

sentences.english: That robber is laden with guilt.
The captured robber grinned at the policeman.
sentences.chinese: 被逮的強盜對警察露齒獰笑。

sentences.english: The robbers hound her hand and foot and left her on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 強盜們捆住她的手腳，把她扔在地板上。

sentences.english: About noon the robbers visited their cave.
sentences.chinese: 到了中午強盜們來視察他們的山洞了。

sentences.english: 《Robber 》reflected the youth revolting the feudalism system.
sentences.chinese: 《強盜》反映了青年人對封建專制制度的反抗。

sentences.english: When the police arrived , the robbers had scrambled out of the windows.
sentences.chinese: 當警察到達時，強盜們匆忙從窗口逃脫。

sentences.english: The beleaguered Jedi Knights fought valiantly to repulse the Mandalorian marauders.
sentences.chinese: 被圍攻的絕地武士英勇戰鬥，擊退了曼達洛強盜。

sentences.english: Mortuary later picked up 40 people survived Gai, also a Canadian and bandit buried in tombs edge.
sentences.chinese: 後人殮拾40人遺賅時，亦一併將強盜屍首葬於墓邊。

sentences.english: The old man laid the robber out with a stick.
sentences.chinese: 老人用一根棍子將強盜打昏在地。

sentences.english: The bandit stripped him of his clothes.
sentences.chinese: 強盜們剝光了他的衣服。

sentences.english: Jack needed time to clear himself of burglary charges.
sentences.chinese: 傑克需要一點時間來澄清自己是強盜的指控罪名。

sentences.english: Bandits, Aproaching the musicians' in the village.
These businessmans failing, taking to the greenwood can't become the first-class robber either.
sentences.chinese: 這些失敗的生意人，落草也不能成爲一流強盜。

sentences.english: Muckraking journalists denounced the titans of American business as "robber barons".
sentences.chinese: 八卦記者曾將美國工商業巨頭直斥爲“強盜頭目”。

definition: variant of 幫凶|帮凶[bang1 xiong1]
you can't guard against it (idiom)/impossible to defend effectively/not much one can do about it/It can't be prevented.
lit. to punch and kick (idiom); to beat up/fig. determined to sort out a problem
lit. bashing sideways and colliding straight on (idiom); to push through shoving and bumping/to barge/to charge around violently
